content: enough yarn left for about 5 row start to work the seed stitch border it s not critical how many row you have can be as few as 2 or as many as 6 4 1 - start on the rs k1 p1 work to 1 stitch before the marker if your last stitch was a knit - then p1 m1r sm k1 m1l p1 then continue to k1 p1 to the last stitch which you knit if your last stitch was a purl - then kfb sm kfb k1 then p1 k1 to the end of row 4 2 - on the ws sl1 wyif then work the stitches p1 k1 to one stitch before the marker make sure you are purling above knit sts and knitting above purl sts purl the stitch before the marker then continue knitting and purling the opposite of the stitch below until you get to the last stitch which you slip pw wyif repeat row 4 1 and 4 2 until you are ready to bind off - you will need approx 4x the length of a row to bind off - you can bind off on rs or ws details below when you get to the last stitch pull through the yarn end to secure you can use the remaining yarn end to sew up the seam on the straight edge leaving a hole big enough to for your head if you don t have enough use a different yarn if you want a reversible cowl sew the seam on the ws as well bind-off using classic lifted bind-off work as follows rs bind-off bind off in pattern i e work the same as row 4 1 lifting over to bind- off ws bind-off bind off in pattern i e work the same as row 4 2 lifting over to bind off when you get to the last stitch purl it through the back loop before lifting over the last time © ashcroft-hempsall 2018 - for personal non-commercial use only
